data.title: Over 80 Quotes about London- inspiration for your next holiday
data.meta_description: If you are looking for London quotes or London Instagram captions I have collated 40 travel quotes about London that express the many faces and moods of the city.
data.text:
By

I love reading good travel quotes so I have put together some of the best quotes about London that I could find. London has something for everyone. You can explore for years and still find something new to see and do around the corner. No wonder it has inspired poets, authors and comedians.

My curated collection of London sayings ranges from funny London quotes to the wisdom of Paddington Bear, some creative captions for London for your social media accounts and a whole lot in between. Some of them are from books, some from London poems and others seem to have been around forever. These are quotes that capture London life and the spirit of London perfectly for me.

From iconic authors to everyday travelers, everyone seems to have something to say about dear old London town. So, grab a cuppa, get comfortable and join me on a journey through some of the most memorable and inspiring quotes about this vibrant city that we call home. Whether you’re a native Londoner or a curious visitor, there’s bound to be a quote that’ll make you see this city in a whole new light.

Gastrotravelogue uses affiliate links. When you click on an affiliate link and purchase a product or service I will receive a small commission. Please note that this does not cost you anything extra.

Easy Reference Guide

Toggle

My favourite quotes about London

Funny London quotes

I don’t know what London’s coming to — the higher the buildings the lower the morals– Noel Coward, Collected Sketches and Lyrics, 1931

Oh, I love London Society! It is entirely composed now of beautiful idiots and brilliant lunatics. Just what society should be. – Oscar Wilde

A person who is tired of London is not necessarily tired of life; it might be that he just can’t find a parking place.– Paul Theroux, American travel writer and novelist

Stopping abruptly in central London is a heinous crime, and immediately gives the people around you permission to kick you –Beth O’Leary ( I can relate to this one. Can you?)

A bad day in London is still better than a good day anywhere else. – Unknown

Yes, London. You know, fish, chips, cup o tea, bad food, worse weather, Mary-fucking-Poppins. London!” – Dennis Farina

Big Ben Quotes

I’m one of those people, in any country I’m in, if somebody could just put me in a car or a bus, I’ll look out the window and say, ‘OK, there’s the Tower of London, there’s Buckingham Palace, there’s Big Ben,’ and if it all takes about five minutes, perfect. I’ve seen all of it and I can go home. – Gilbert GottfriedJimmy Kimmel – American television host,

How can you ever be late for anything in London? They have a huge clock right in the middle of the town –Jimmy Kimmel – American television host, comedian, writer, actor, and producer.

I first came to London when I was 22 and working as a roadie. Having watched the ‘News At Ten’ all my life, I thought Big Ben was going to be massive, but I was underwhelmed. – Noel Gallagher

Big Ben was beginning to strike, first the warning, musical; then the hour, irrevocable. – Virginia Woolf

London is not a city, London is a person. Tower Bridge talks to you; National Gallery reads a poem for you; Hyde Park dances with you; Palace of Westminster plays the piano; Big Ben and St Pauls Cathedral sing an opera! London is not a city; it is a talented artist who is ready to contact with you directly – Mehmet Murat ildan

London weather quotes

Why is it that London is infamous for its grey skies and bad weather? Although there is lots of rain in London the sunny days are worth waiting for and make the winter seem a long way away.

I’m leaving because the weather is too good. I hate London when it’s not raining – Groucho Marx

Take a perfect day, add six hours of rain and fog, and you have instant London – Anonymous

The English mist is always at work like a subtle painter, and London is a vast canvas prepared for the mist to work on – Arthur Symons, Cities and Sea-Coasts and Islands

Wet weather in London, but when was it anything else? – Cassandra Clare

Everything in London is quite good, apart from the weather: it’s cold and rainy there, and the winter is long –Sayed Kashua

London is too full of fogs and serious people. Whether the fogs produce the serious people, or whether the serious people produce the fogs, I don’t know – Oscar Wilde

Quotes about London Eye

I got to take my kids to the London eye with no one looking at me like I was Johnny Depp. They did look at me like I was some kind of sicko walking around with beautiful kids, but I had a perfect disguise. – Johnny Depp

The best thing about the London Eye is the journey. It’s not like the Eiffel tower, where you get in a dark lift and come out on to a platform at the top. The trip round is as important as the view. – Julia Barfield

London quotes poems

Go where we may, rest where we will,/Eternal London haunts us still – Thomas Moore “Rhymes on the Road”

A mighty mass of brick, and smoke, and shipping, / Dirty and dusty, but as wide as eye /Could reach, with here and there a sail just skipping / In sight, then lost amidst the forestry /Of masts; a wilderness of steeples peeping / On tiptoe through their sea-coal canopy;/A huge, dun cupola, like a foolscap crown /On a fool’s head–and there is London Town- Lord Byron, Don Juan

I journeyed to London, to the timekept City, / Where the River flows, with foreign flotations. /There I was told: we have too many churches, /And too few chop-houses.-T. S. Eliot, The Rock

I love thee, London! for thy many men, / And for thy mighty deeds and scenes of glory – Philip Jamea Bailey “London”, The Angel World and Other Poems

Unreal City, / Under the brown fog of a winter dawn. /A crowd flowed over London Bridge, so many, / I had not thought death had undone so many. / Sighs, short and infrequent, were exhaled,/ And each man fixed his eyes before his feet – T.S. Eliot, The Waste Land

And marbled clouds go scudding by / The many-steepled London sky – John Betjeman

London, thou art the flower of cities all! – William Dunbar

Dickens quotes about London

If the parks be “the lungs of London” we wonder what Greenwich Fair is — a periodical breaking out, we suppose — a sort of spring rash- Charles Dickens, Greenwich Fair

Paddington London quotes

In London, everyone is different, and that means anyone can fit in – One of the cutest bears around, polite, intelligent and originally from Peru

London City Quotes

Aesthetically, London is just beautiful; it’s a gorgeous city. The architecture, monuments, the parks, the small streets – it’s an incredible place to be – Sara Bareilles, singer-songwriter

One of the things I most liked about the city – apart from all its obvious attractions, the theatre, the galleries, the exhilarating walks by the river – was that so few people ever asked you personal questions – Julia Gregson, a British author

My Dad says that being a Londoner has nothing to do with where you’re born. He says that there are people who get off a jumbo jet at Heathrow, go through immigration waving any kind of passport, hop on the tube and by the time the train’s pulled into Piccadilly Circus they’ve become a Londoner – Ben Aaronovitch, English author

Recommended: St Paul’s Cathedral Entry Ticket

Harry Potter London quotes

Don’t let the Muggles get you down! Try and come to London – JK Rowling

Even if I could, I wouldn’t. Scars can come in handy. I have one myself above my left knee that is a perfect map of the London Underground – JK Rowling

And the ground and the dirty buildings on either side fell away, dropping out of sight as the car rose; in seconds, the whole of London lay, smoky and glittering, below them – JK Rowling

Recommended: From London: Harry Potter Warner Bros Studio Tour AND Harry Potter Locations Walking Tour

Short quotes about London

There’s nowhere else like London. Nothing at all, anywhere – Vivienne Westwood

I think London’s sexy because it’s so full of eccentrics – Rachel Weisz, English actress

London is a bad habit one hates to lose.– William Sansom British novelist

To walk alone in London is the greatest rest – Virginia Woolf

When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life – Samuel Johnson

Nothing is certain in London but expense– William Shenstone

New York has a great energy, but London is better -Jaime Winstone, English actress

Keep calm and go to London – Unknown

If you’re curious, London’s an amazing place – David Bailey, fashion and portrait photographer

By seeing London, I have seen as much of life as the world can show – Samuel Johnson

London is a riddle. Paris is an explanation– Ernest Hemingway

If London is a watercolour, New York is an oil painting– Peter Shaffer

I’ve been walking about London for the last thirty years, and I find something fresh in it every day – Walter Besant

London on your own actually seems more exotic than Egypt on a tour – Laura Fraser

Loads of tourists must be attracted by the fact that you could spend a week in London doing nothing but visit superb museums and galleries, free – Simon Hoggart

I love being in London because it means I am breathing the same air as the Queen– Melissa George

Recommended: The London Eye Entry Ticket AND Tower of London and Crown Jewels Exhibition Ticket

London quotes for Instagram

These short captions are just perfect for your London Instagram feed. They might be cheesy, but some of them are quite clever.

London is my cup of tea

Home is where the palace is

I can’t be Thamed

Eye came. Eye saw. Eye conquered.

50 Shades of Earl Grey

Having the best Thames in London

Relationship status: crushing on Big Ben

Sticks and scones may break my bones…

Let’s cross that London Bridge when we come to it.

Money can’t buy you happiness, but it can buy you a ticket to London

LonDONE

Visiting Buckingham Palace but I’m having a bad heir day!

London is calling, so I must go.

All you need is love and a vacation in London.

Living like the royals

Keep calm and go to London.

From London with love

When in doubt, follow your heart to London.

Falling hard for London.

There’s no time to be bored in London.

Mind the gap – London Underground

Recommended: Westminster to Greenwich River Thames Cruise AND Madame Tussauds London

Funny London quotes

What a brew-tiful day!

I tried to grab a pic of London fog, but I mist.

Trying to make our way around London, but we don’t have the foggiest idea where we are!

The fog was so thick we mist our tour.

London travel quotes

The vibe of London as a city is captivating. It’s both fast-paced and rushed but still has the calmness that would attract any big-city person.”– Ali Fazal

When exploring London, you will come across lots of excitement by chance, so try to take everything in rather than just rushing around to all of the major tourist haunts.”– Richard Branson

London opens to you like a novel itself… It is divided into chapters, the chapters into scenes, the scenes into sentences; it opens to you like a series of rooms, doors and passages. Mayfair to Piccadilly to Soho to the Strand.”– Anna Quindlen

The streets of London have their map, but our passions are uncharted. What are you going to meet if you turn this corner?– Virginia Woolf

Recommended: Tower Bridge Entry Ticket AND City Sightseeing Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour

Songs about London

Maybe it’s because I’m a Londoner / That I love London so / Maybe it’s because I’m a Londoner / That I think of her wherever I go / I get a funny feeling inside of me / Just walking up and down / Maybe it’s because I’m a Londoner / That I love London town -Hubert Gregg

There’s a hole in the world / Like a great black pit / And the vermin of the world / Inhabit it / And it goes by the name of London. – Stephen Sondheim

So, how can you tell me you’re lonely?/ Don’t say for you that the sun don’t shine/ Let me take you by the hand /And lead you through the streets of London /Show you something to make you change your mind – Ralph McTell

London calling to the faraway towns /Now war is declared and battle come down/ London calling to the underworld/ Come out of the cupboard, you boys and girls/ London calling, now don’t look to us/ Phony Beatlemania has bitten the dust/ London calling, see we ain’t got no swing/Except for the ring of the truncheon thing – The Clash

As we wrap up our tour of London quotes, it’s clear that this city holds a special place in the hearts and minds of people from all walks of life. From Shakespeare’s words to Dickens London has inspired countless generations with its charm, complexity, and endless possibilities.

So let’s keep exploring, discovering, and falling in love with London, one quote at a time. Cheers to this fascinating city and all the adventures ahead,

Recommended: LHR London Heathrow Airport: Plaza Premium Lounge
